title: Dominican Republic - Conflict Data
org: Armed Conflict Location & Event Data Project (ACLED)

bites.title: Map of locations
bite: Police Forces of the Dominican Republic (2020-)
On 16 December 2020, in Dajabon, Dajabon, 162 undocumented Haitians were detained and repatriated.
Police Forces of the Dominican Republic (2020-)

On 28 November 2020, in Santo Domingo, Distrito Nacional, the second-in-command of the Village de Dieu Gang, a gang active in Haiti, was arrested by police. He will be handed over to Haitian authorities.
On 28 October 2020, in Santo Domingo, Distrito Nacional, hundreds of lawyers protested to demand the reopening of courts. [size=hundreds]

On 27 October 2020, in Dajabon, Dajabon, Haitians merchants in the Dominican Republic protested. The protesters say that the trade agreements in place between Haiti and the Dominican Republic benefit rich Haitian merchants and not the poor ones. During the protest, the border was closed for a few hours. [size=no report]
On 21 October 2020, in Dajabon, Dajabon, Haitian nationals protested after a Haitian was shot death at the border by a Dominican border guard. [size=no report]

On 20 October 2020, in Santo Domingo, Distrito Nacional, a group of women held the traditional March of the Brides on the campus of the Autonomous University of Santo Domingo to call attention to the problem of domestic violence. The march was organized by teaching staff of the university. [size=no report]
Military Forces of the Dominican Republic (2020-)

On 18 October 2020, in Elias Pina state, workers from Haiti started demonstrating after they received their payment. The army was called in to stop the demonstration, and the Haitians started throwing rocks at them. Two soldiers were wounded by rocks. Motive of the demonstration unknown. [size=no report]

On 16 October 2020, in San Felipe de Puerto Plata, San Felipe de Puerto Plata, a group of people attempted to lynch a man who allegedly tried to rape two minors. The girls managed to escape by smashing the man's head with a rock, and then relatives physically assaulted him before others pulled the relatives off him to prevent a lynching. [size=no report]
Military Forces of the Dominican Republic (2020-)

Around 15 October 2020 (as reported), at the Dominican-Haitian border, nearly 10.000 Dominican troops were mobilized in order to combat human trafficking, following an increase in unrest and gang violence in the north-east of Haiti.

On 8 October 2020, in Santo Domingo, Distrito Nacional, a power outage in some parts of the city provoked protests in the Villa Maria, Mejoramiento Social and Guacupita neighbourhoods. [size=no report]

On 7 October 2020, in San Juan de la Maguana, San Juan, some 60 families protested in front of the national palace, accusing the governor of the province of illegally dispossessing them of their homes. [size=some 60 families]

On 29 September 2020, in Santo Domingo, Distrito Nacional, market vendors protested in front of the national palace to ask to be allowed to sell their wares from the place where they traditionally have done so. The mayor of Santo Domingo Oeste asked them to move two weeks prior, saying this was a temporary measure. The new location which was allocated to them has paralysed the market and trades. [size=no report]

On 17 September 2020, in Santiago de los Caballeros, Santiago de los Caballeros, residents of the Rafey area protested as a convicted murder was released from prison. The residents shouted 'murderer' at him. The man was allowed to leave prison pending a habeas corpus petition filed on his behalf. [size=no report]
Police Forces of the Dominican Republic (2020-)

On 5 September 2020, in Santiago de los Caballeros, Santiago, a shootout between police and unidentified armed men led to the injuring of three police officers who got hit by bullets in their legs and head. No fatalities.
Police Forces of the Dominican Republic (2004-)
Around 11 July 2020 (as reported), near Sabana de la Mar, Hato Mayor, police arrested 27 people attempting to illegally cross out of Puerto Rico in two dinghies.

On 17 June 2020, in Santa Cruz de Barahona, Barahona, a group of lawyers protested in front of the palace of justice to ask that the judicial processes would be started again. All court cases have been stopped since the confinement guidelines due to coronavirus were implemented. [size=no report]
Police Forces of the Dominican Republic (2004-)

On 15 June 2020, in Santo Domingo, Distrito Federal, at least 27 people gathered on the Plaza la Trinitaria to protest against the arrest of Presidential candidate Karim Abu Naba', who was arrested for violating coronavirus related rules on social distancing. Police arrested seven protesters and told around 20 others to disperse. [size=at least 27]

On 11 June 2020, outside Salvaleon de Higuey, La Altagracia, two local politicians were killed by gunmen after being intercepted while driving on the highway. The two politicians were members of the local council of the town La Otras Banda. A third man was injured. 2 fatalities.
Police Forces of the Dominican Republic (2004-)

On 9 June 2020, in Santo Domingo, Distrito Federal, two groups of protesters were about to clash with each other when police intervened and dispersed the group. A protest in solidarity with the Black Lives Matter movement was confronted by a counter-protest of a nationalist group. The police arrested three human rights activists who were participating in the demonstration. [size=no report]
Military Forces of the Dominican Republic (2004-)
Around 29 May 2020, in San Pedro de Macoris, the navy arrested 34 people who were attempting to make an illegal journey to Puerto Rico. [size=no report]
Police Forces of the Dominican Republic (2004-)

On 16 May 2020, in Bonao, Monsenor Nouel, police officers went to break up an event which was in violation of the coronavirus curfew, when they were attacked by a mob throwing stones. One officer had to be hospitalised. [size=no report]
On 8 May 2020, in Santo Domingo, Distrito Nacional, dozens garbage collectors protested against a lack of payment. [size=dozens]
Police Forces of the Dominican Republic (2004-)
On 30 March 2020, in Manoguayabo, Santo Domingo, two men on a motorcycle shot and killed a police officer in a drive-by shooting.

On 19 March 2020 the border between Haiti and the Dominican Republic was closed to prevent the spread of coronavirus. On 20 March 2020 throughout the Dominican Republic a curfew was imposed. On 27 March 2020 the curfew was extended.
MINPC: Nigua Independent Movement for Change; We For When; Eagle of Bani Movement

On 13 March 2020, in Santo Domingo representatives of three political movements chained themselves to the headquarters of the Central Electoral Board, joined by around 12 other members of these same movements. They demand the money which they invested in the municipal elections that were suspended be paid back. [size=around 12]
Police Forces of the Dominican Republic (2004-)

On 11 March 2020, in Santo Domingo medical staff protested to demand the government to comply with previously agreed upon salary and retirement legislation. Police used shields and fences, as well as blows and kicks to keep the protestors away from the national palace. [size=no report]
Police Forces of the Dominican Republic (2004-)

Between 9 and 12 March 2020, in the provinces Azua, Barahona, Santiago, Santiago Rodriguez, Valverde, Duarte, Sanchez Ramirez, Espaillat, Hermanas Mirabal, La Vega and Santo Domingo, migration officers conducted a mass arrest of 2100 undocumented Haitians in a variety of locations throughout the country which were then deported from the country. Human trafficking of undocumented Haitians is a large criminal enterprise in the Dominican Republic.
Police Forces of the Dominican Republic (2004-)

Between 9 and 12 March 2020, in the provinces Azua, Barahona, Santiago, Santiago Rodriguez, Valverde, Duarte, Sanchez Ramirez, Espaillat, Hermanas Mirabal, La Vega and Santo Domingo, migration officers conducted a mass arrest of 2100 undocumented Haitians in a variety of locations throughout the country which were then deported from the country. Human trafficking of undocumented Haitians is a large criminal enterprise in the Dominican Republic.
Police Forces of the Dominican Republic (2004-)

Human trafficking of undocumented Haitians is a large criminal enterprise in the Dominican Republic.

Human trafficking of undocumented Haitians is a large criminal enterprise in the Dominican Republic.

Human trafficking of undocumented Haitians is a large criminal enterprise in the Dominican Republic.
Police Forces of the Dominican Republic (2004-)

Between 9 and 12 March 2020, in the provinces Azua, Barahona, Santiago, Santiago Rodriguez, Valverde, Duarte, Sanchez Ramirez, Espaillat, Hermanas Mirabal, La Vega and Santo Domingo, migration officers conducted a mass arrest of 2100 undocumented Haitians in a variety of locations throughout the country which were then deported from the country. Human trafficking of undocumented Haitians is a large criminal enterprise in the Dominican Republic.
On 9 March 2020, in Santo Domingo, a group of protesters picketed in front of the federal courthouse to protest against the construction of a hotel. [size=no report]
On 4 March 2020, in Santiago de los Caballeros, Santiago, a man was shot dead by unknown perpetrators in the Reparto Peralta sector of the Bella Vista neighbourhood. Motive unknown. 1 fatality.

On 27 February 2020 in Santo Domingo, hundreds of people staged in a protest demanding the resignation of the central electoral board (JCE) after the suspension of the municipal elections on February 16. [size=hundreds]

On 23 February 2020 in Santo Domingo, thousands of people participated in a protest march called 'March for Democracy', organized by more than ten opposition parties. Participating in the march, the president of the Partido Reformista Social Cristiano (PRSC) said people are protesting impunity, debt, insecurity, unemployment and 'haitinization'. [size=thousands]
On 21 February 2020 in Santo Domingo, thousands of people protested against the electoral board for canceling the municipal elections after the automated voting system failed. [size=thousands]

On 20 February 2020 in Mao, there was a protest demanding the resignation of the electoral board for canceling the municipal elections on February 16 after the automated voting system failed. [size=no report]

On 20 February 2020 in La Romana, there was a protest demanding the resignation of the electoral board for canceling the municipal elections on February 16 after the automated voting system failed. [size=no report]

On 20 February 2020 in Nagua, there was a protest demanding the resignation of the electoral board for canceling the municipal elections on February 16 after the automated voting system failed. [size=no report]

On 20 February 2020 in Samana, there was a protest demanding the resignation of the electoral board for canceling the municipal elections on February 16 after the automated voting system failed. [size=no report]

On 20 February 2020 in Santo Domingo, thousands of people, including students, artists, athletes, and politicians, staged a protest demanding the resignation of the electoral board for canceling the municipal elections on February 16 after the automated voting system failed. [size=thousands]

On 20 February 2020 in Cotui, dozens of people protested against the electoral board, demanding their resignation for canceling the municipal elections after the automated voting system failed. [size=dozens]

On 20 February 2020 in Montecristi by Villa Vazquez, there was a protest demanding the resignation of the electoral board for canceling the municipal elections on February 16 after the automated voting system failed. [size=no report]

On 20 February 2020 in Guayabal, Azua, there was a protest demanding the resignation of the electoral board for canceling the municipal elections on February 16 after the automated voting system failed. [size=no report]

On 19 February 2020 in Puerto Plata, there was a protest demanding the resignation of the electoral board for canceling the municipal elections after the automated voting system failed on February 16. [size=no report]

On 19 February 2020 in Barahona, there was a protest demanding the resignation of the electoral board for canceling the municipal elections after the automated voting system failed on February 16. [size=no report]

On 19 February 2020 in San Pedro, there was a protest demanding the resignation of the electoral board for canceling the municipal elections after the automated voting system failed on February 16. [size=no report]

On 19 February 2020 in Santo Domingo, thousands of people dressed in black protested against the electoral board for canceling the municipal elections after the automated voting system failed. [size=hundreds]

On 19 February 2020 in La Vega, there was a protest demanding the resignation of the electoral board for canceling the municipal elections after the automated voting system failed on February 16. [size=no report]

On 19 February 2020 in Jarabacoa, there was a protest demanding the resignation of the electoral board for canceling the municipal elections after the automated voting system failed on February 16. [size=no report]

On 19 February 2020 in Santiago, there was a protest demanding the resignation of the electoral board for canceling the municipal elections after the automated voting system failed on February 16. [size=no report]

On 19 February 2020 in San Cristobal, there was a protest demanding the resignation of the electoral board for canceling the municipal elections after the automated voting system failed on February 16. [size=no report]

On 19 February 2020 in Nagua, there was a protest demanding the resignation of the electoral board for canceling the municipal elections after the automated voting system failed on February 16. [size=no report]
On 18 February 2020 in Santo Domingo, hundreds of people protested against the electoral board for canceling the municipal elections after the automated voting system failed. [size=hundreds]

On 17 February 2020 in Santo Domingo, dozens of people dressed in black protested against the electoral board for canceling the municipal elections after the automated voting system failed. [size=dozens]
On 16 February 2020 in Santo Domingo, a member of the PLD was shot and killed in a shootout between members of the PLD and the PRM parties, just as the municipal elections were canceled.
Police Forces of the Dominican Republic (2004-)

On 15 February 2020 in Santo Domingo and 12 other provinces, at least two thousand immigrants without documents were arrested. Among them were 1500 Haitians who were sent back to Haiti, while the remaining 500, with various nationalities, were detained by immigration authorities.
On 15 February 2020, in Enriquillo by Tamayo, there was a shootout between members of the PLD and the PRM parties as the elections were about to start. At least two people were injured.
On 14 February 2020 in Montecristi by Villa Vazquez, there was a shootout between members of the PLD and the PRM parties in connection with the municipal elections, leaving two people injured.
Police Forces of the Dominican Republic (2004-)
On 13 February 2020 in Bani, the PRM candidate for mayor reported he was assaulted by municipal police officers while he was driving through the area with his wife and another PRM candidate.
Police Forces of the Dominican Republic (2004-)
On 13 February 2020 in Haina, Santo Domingo, there was a shootout between the police and a criminal group, two police officers were injured and a civilian was killed.
Police Forces of the Dominican Republic (2004-)
Between 10 and 13 February 2020 in Santo Domingo, 866 Haitian immigrants were detained and deported from several towns across the Dominican Republic.
Police Forces of the Dominican Republic (2004-)
On 09 February 2020, in La Penita by Boca Chica, 80 Haitian immigrants without documentation were detained and expelled to Haiti.
Police Forces of the Dominican Republic (2004-)

On 30 January 2020, in Fantino outside Cotui, residents staged a protest, blocking the road for several hours to demand the construction of a highway. The police intervened and two protesters, a local priest and a nun, were injured. [size=no report]
Police Forces of the Dominican Republic (2004-)

On 21 January 2020 in Santo Domingo, 806 haitian immigrants were arrested and handed over to migration authorities. The border police also confiscated several vehicles, tobacco, marihuana, and food that was being transported.
Military Forces of the Dominican Republic (2004-)
On 07 January 2020 in the area of Saona island, south of Punta Cana, 35 people were detained by naval officers, arrested and charged with attempting illegal migration to Puerto Rico.
Military Forces of the Dominican Republic (2004-)
On 07 January 2020 in the area of San Pedro de Macoris, 28 people were detained by naval officers, arrested and charged with attempting illegal migration to Puerto Rico.
Police Forces of the Dominican Republic (2004-)
Between 02 and 06 January 2020 in Santo Domingo and seven other provinces, 1012 Haitian immigrants were arrested and 939 of them were deported.
Police Forces of the Dominican Republic (2004-)

On 04 January 2020 in La Romana, two men on a motorbike were detained by a police patrol and handcuffed. The men, wanted for various crimes, were then found dead, and the four police officers have been accused of killing them and suspended from the force.
Military Forces of the Dominican Republic (2004-)

Between 16 and 20 December 2019 in Santiago de los Caballeros, a Haitian immigrant was shot and killed when a military patrol opened fire on a vehicle carrying Haitian immigrants, which had refused the order to stop at a border checkpoint.
Teachers (Dominican Republic); ADP: Dominican Professors Association

On 12 December 2019 in Santiago de los Caballeros, professors from the ADP (Dominican Professors' Association) union protested in front of the regional education office, demanding chairs for the classrooms, where many students have to sit on the floor, as well as school lunches for the students. [size=no report]
PRM: Modern Revolutionary Party; PLD: Dominican Liberation Party; Country Alliance

On 25 November 2019 in Santo Domingo, tens of thousands of protesters participated in the March of the Butterflies against violence against women, including representatives from parties Revolucionario Moderno, Liberacion Dominicana and Alianza Pais. [size=tens of thousands]
On 25 November 2019 in Santo Domingo, thousands of Catholics protested in support of the Dominican family in an event organized by the archbishop called _ step for my family_ [size=thousands]
Students (Dominican Republic); Teachers (Dominican Republic); Women (Dominican Republic)

On 23 November 2019 in Santo Domingo, dozens of women connected with the Autonomous University protested against violence against women with the _ride march_ marching through the campus dressed in wedding dresses. [size=dozens]
Former Police Forces of Dominican Republic (2004-)

On 19 November 2019 in Villa Verde, Santiago, a retired police officer was attacked in his home, he suffered serious knife injuries and head trauma. He died from the injuries in hospital on November 23.
Police Forces of the Dominican Republic (2004-)

On 17 November 2019 in Santo Domingo, the police intervened a protests staged by pilgrims who were marching to the National Palace, protesting for land rights, resulting in ten injured protesters. [size=no report]
On November 7, 2019, in Santo Domingo, parents and professors protested outside the Ministry of Education, demanding urgent action to improve conditions in their school in Haina. [size=no report]
On November 7, 2019, in Santo Domingo, a group of engineers and architects protested in front of the Ministry of Education, demanding to be paid for school construction projects. [size=no report]
Police Forces of the Dominican Republic (2004-)
On November 6, 2019, in Higuey, a man was killed and another injured by three police officers. On November 13, the officers have been arrested and are awaiting trial.

On October 8, 2019, in Santo Domingo, members of the Partido de la Liberacion Dominicana (PLD) protested in front of the Central Electoral Board after the elections held on October 6, where they say there was election fraud. Hundreds of police and military were guarding the premises, but no intervention happened. [size=no report]
Military Forces of the Dominican Republic (2004-)

On September 17, 2019, in Santo Domingo, the commander in chief of the Dominican Republic_ army said the border with Haiti is now completely sealed shut and no one can pass, due to the unrest in Haiti over fuel shortage.
Police Forces of the Dominican Republic (2004-)
On September 17, 2019, in San Juan de la Maguana, a police sergeant major fired shots at a primary school, injuring two children. The policeman is detained and the children are in stable condition.
Police Forces of the Dominican Republic (2004-)

On September 3 2019, in Gurabo, Santiago, Police forces killed a young man that had supposedly not obeyed the call from police forces to stop when he was on his motorcycle. Police forces claimed that they asked the man to stop as he was suspicious, and they thought the man was carrying a gun in his belt, but it turned out to be a household weapon called 'Chilena'.

On August 27 2019, in Baitoa, Santiago, citizens of communities near the city staged a demonstration by burning tires and blocking main highways in the city to demand the municipal government to provide them with potable water and improvement in the electric service that has been limited. [size=no report]
Police Forces of the Dominican Republic (2004-)

On August 25 2019, in Boca Chica, Santo Domingo, a journalist was arrested by police forces for hours and beaten repeatedly because according to police forces he had parked incorrectly in public zones. There were 7 different claims of the same abuse from police forces who had arrested several people, including a minor.
On August 22, 2019, in Santo Domingo, thousands of teachers went on strike and protested in the streets demanding better conditions in public schools. [size=thousands]
On August 14, 2019, in Puerto Plata, hundreds of teachers protested against the Ministry of Education_ evaluation tests for teachers. [size=hundreds]
August 11, 2019, in Santiago, a lawyer was shot in the head, close to his home. He was taken to hospital in critical condition. His family claims he was shot by a police patrol.

On July 20, 2019, in Santo Domingo, a man was shot and killed and another man injured by two armed men. The man killed was an off-duty police officer, and the men who killed him were reported to be involved in drug sales in the neighborhood.
PRM: Modern Revolutionary Party; FALPO: Broad Front for People's Fight; PRSD: Social Democrat Revolutionary Party; Common Good

On 12 July 2019, in Santo Domingo, thousands of protesters gathered in front of Congress to protest against the President's plans to reform the Constitution so he can seek a third term. The protesters were mostly from the opposition PRM party, as well as from the FALPO, PRSD, and Common Good. Thousands of police officers guarded the area from early in the morning. [size=thousands]

On 4 July 2019, approximately 45 protesters gathered in the Francisco del Rosario Sanchez park in San Juan de la Maguana. They protested a possible modification of the constitution that would make the President's reelection possible. Protest leader was MP Henry Meran from the PLD. [size=45]

On June 26, 2019, in Santo Domingo, Ozama, people staged a demonstration to reject the change in the constitution that would allow the current president to run for a second period. They rejected this decision as it would be an opportunistic decision to change the constitution without any reason. [size=100]
Students (Dominican Republic); Government of the Dominican Republic (2004-)
Police Forces of the Dominican Republic (2004-)
Military Forces of the Dominican Republic (2004-)

On June 24, 2019, in Santo Domingo, Ozama, students and congressmen that were outside the National Congress offices protesting against the government changing the constitution, were violently repressed by Police forces and Military forces. They used tear gas bombs, rubber bullets and started hitting them, leaving 8 demonstrators injured. [size=no report]
Health Workers (Dominican Republic); Teachers (Dominican Republic); Students (Dominican Republic)
Police Forces of the Dominican Republic (2004-)

On June 6, 2019, in Santo Domingo, Ozama, health workers, students and medicine teachers staged a demonstration against the law proposed by the government that would introduce exams for the medical residencies. Police forces intervened and became aggressive towards the peaceful demonstrators. They used tear gas to disperse the demonstrators, that caused a conflict with them. [size=no report]

On June 6, 2019, in Santo Domingo Este, Ozama, citizens staged a violent demonstration in the sector by burning tires and putting debris to demand stable electric service that has been a problem for days. This is the second day of demonstrations. [size=no report]
FALPO: Broad Front for People's Fight

On June 5, 2019, in Esperanza, Cibao Noroeste, members of the Broad Front for People's Fight staged a demonstration by marching in the streets of the city demanding maintenance of streets and that the government finishes the remodeling of the municipal hospital offered. [size=no report]
Police Forces of the Dominican Republic (2004-)

On June 5, 2019, in Santo Domingo Oeste, Ozama, citizens staged a violent demonstration in the sector by burning tires and putting debris to demand stable electric service that has been a problem for days. Police forces intervened in the demonstration by throwing tear gas bombs after the demonstrators started to throw rocks. This is the first day of demonstrations. [size=no report]
FALPO: Broad Front for People's Fight

On June 5, 2019, in Mejia de Navarrete, Cibao Norte, members of the Broad Front for People's Fight staged marched in the streets of the city demanding maintenance of streets and that the government finishes the remodeling of the municipal hospital offered. Shots could be heard from people that were not part of the demonstration, however, no one was injured and it was unclear were they came from. The demonstrators did not stop with this event. [size=no report]
Police Forces of the Dominican Republic (2004-)

On May 29, 2019, Moca, Cibao Norte, a man was killed by police forces. The young man had been arrested before, but he had fulfilled his sentence. Additionally, family members and friends mentioned he was not armed and he was shot more than 8 times even though he didn't resist the arrest.

On May 28, 2019, in Los Alcarrizos, Santo Domingo, Ozama, young people carried out a march from Santiago and reached Los Alcarrizos where they staged a demonstration against the reform of the constitution that would allow the current president to run again as president. [size=63]

On May 23, 2019, in San Francisco de Macoris, Cibao Nordeste, members of ASODEMU (Higher education workers association) staged a demonstration by blocking the entry to the main offices. They demanded that members that had their contracts changed to occasional or other similar contracts to be changed as they were before. Also, they demanded their wages and extra hours are paid to all members, including the members of security of the campus. [size=no report]

On May 17, 2019, inhabitants of the city of Bonao, Monsenor Mouel, Cibao Sur, Dominican Republic, burned their electricity bills to protest high electricity prices and lack of services. [size=no report]
Police Forces of the Dominican Republic (2004-)

On May 7, 2019, a man was killed during a riot during which the participants threw tree trunks and other objects in the town of Navarrete, Biono, Santiago, Cibao Norte, Dominican Republic. The police attempted controlling the situation. [size=no report]

On April 25, 2019, a Haitian citizen was stabbed and killed by a group of Haitian citizens at the La Cienega stop in the Los Corozos sector in the city of San Jose de Ocoa, Valdesia, Dominican Republic. This allegedly as a result of the victim robbing in the area. [size=no report]
On April 11, 2019, the Dominican government confirmed that over the last 48 hours over 1000 Haitian citizens were arrested due to their undocumented status.
On April 2 2019, hundreds of people took the streets of Santiago de loss Caballeros, Cibao Norte, Dominican Republic, to protest changes in labor agreements. [size=200]

On March 22 2019, a group of Haitian and Dominican men confronted each other with machetes and ended up in the hospital in the Los Altagracianos community in the city of Pedernales, Enriquillo, Dominican Republic.
Police Forces of the Dominican Republic (2004-)

On February 23 2019, a man was shot and killed by the Dominican police, when several Haitian citizens allegedly threw rocks at the police out of protest against them patrolling the area. [size=no report]
On 18 February 2019, taxi drivers protested in the border town of Pedernales (Enriquillo) against Haitian taxi drivers crossing the border to work. [size=no report]
On February 13 2019, people working in the educational field protested in front of the Ministry of Education in Santo Domingo, Dominican Republic. [size=no report]
On February 5 2019, a man of Haitian citizenship was shot and killed by unknown gunmen in Fundacion, Barahona, Dominican Republic, as he allegedly practiced sorcery.

On 23 December 2018, a group of people led by nationalist groups protested in the Mirador Sur park in Santo Domingo against the Haitians migrants that are in the country. The police were present during the protest.

On 9 December 2018, a group of people gathered in the Independence Park in Santo Domingo to protest against corruption. During the action representatives from different political parties and movements signed a compromise against corruption.

On 7 December 2018, a group of peasants led a HR defender protested in front of the Congress to demand the respect of the property rights of the peasant to keep their land that might be given to foreigners.
Police Forces of the Dominican Republic (2004-2020)

Around 7 December 2018, a group of peasants protested in Pantoja against the appropriation of land that was meant to be used to build a school. During the protest, the police arrested 15 people that were underaged. [size=no report]
On 26 November 2018, during a general strike in Barahona, Dominican Republic, demonstrators burned tires and blocked roads. A person was injured.
On 17 November 2018, independent drivers in San Francisco de Macoris, Dominican Republic, protested against lowering the charges to passengers.
On 30 October 2018, a law student was shot and killed by unknown gunmen driving by on a motorcycle in San Pedro de Macoris, Dominican Republic.
Police Forces of the Dominican Republic (2004-2020)
On 29 October 2018, rioters demanding the decrease of gasoline prices in Santiago, Dominican Republic, fired gunshots and set on fire tires and trash. One policeman was wounded. [size=no report]
Police Forces of the Dominican Republic (2004-2020)
On 29 October 2018, several people were injured during a riot in Bonao, Dominican Republic, against increasing fuel prices. [size=no report]
Police Forces of the Dominican Republic (2004-2020)

On 19 October 2018, clashes between the police and rioters broke out in Salcedo, Dominican Republic, after rioters set on fire trash and tires and launched bombs during a regional strike. [size=no report]

On 29 October 2018, rioters demanding the decrease of gasoline prices in Nagua, Cibao, Dominican Republic, burned tires. Two people were injured as they started to discuss with rioters. [size=no report]
Police Forces of the Dominican Republic (2004-2020)

On 29 October 2018, one person was shot and killed by police during protests in San Francisco de Macoris against increasing fuel prices in San Francisco de Macoris, Dominican Republic. [size=no report]

On 29 October 2018, a Haitian citizen was killed during a drive-by shooting in San Francisco de Macoris during a protest in the Ribera del Jaya neighbourhood. The victim was participating in the protest and several people were injured.
On 28 October 2018, rioters in Moca, Cibao, Dominican Republic, burned tires and blocked roads during a regional strike.

On 28 October 2018, two people were shot by unknown gunmen during a regional strike in San Francisco de Macoris, Cibao Norte, Dominican Republic, as they refused to close their shops. Groups of people on motorcycle forced people to participate in the strike.
Police Forces of the Dominican Republic (2004-2020)

On 25 October 2018, two men were shot and killed and three others injured by the police in Santo Domingo, Dominican Republic, after the policemen invaded several stores at the Mercado Nuevo de Villas Agricolas y Capotillo in a operation against drug trafficking. Policemen allegedly responded to people launching bottles and stones.
Police Forces of the Dominican Republic (2004-2020)

On 22 October 2018, the accidental death of a Haitian student during a police operation in Santiago de Los Caballeros, Dominican Republic, triggered a protest by Dominican and Haitian nationals that was dispersed with gunshots by police, wounding one. [size=no report]
On 17 October 2018, residents of Tamayo, Dominican Republic, continued the protest of the previous day, against the poor road conditions in the community.
On 16 October 2018, residents of Tamayo, Dominican Republic, initiated a strike and took the streets to protest the poor road conditions in the community.
Police Forces of the Dominican Republic (2004-2020)

On 16 October 2018, a police man was injured by a gunshot during a general strike and demonstration in Bonao, Dominican Republic, calling for the construction of the hospital in Bonao. [size=no report]
FENATRANO: National Transport Federation The New Option; Taxi/Bus Drivers (Dominican Republic); Labour Group (Dominican Republic)

On 8 October 2018, bus drivers working for la Federacion Nacional la Nueva Opcion (Fenatrano) protested and went on strike in Santo Domingo, Dominican Republic, causing thousands of people to be stranded not able to reach their place of employment.
FALPO: Broad Front for People's Fight
Police Forces of the Dominican Republic (2004-2020)

On 8 October 2018, during a strike in Tenares, Dominican Republic, three people were arrested for burning tires and setting of fabricated bombs. The demonstrators went on strike to demand for the construction of better roads, among other things. [size=no report]
FALPO: Broad Front for People's Fight

On 3 October 2018, two people in Esperanza, Dominican Republic, were shot and injured during a protest organized by FALPO against the eviction of various families as some unknown men fired shots in the middle of the protest.
On 22 September 2018, in Tenares, Hermanas Mirabal, dozens of residents in the city marched in a demonstration to demand the construction of public road works in the community. [size=dozens].
On 11 September 2018, parents and other people connected to the Rafael Kasse Acta primary school in Los Alcarrizos, Dominican Republic, protested against the closing of the school.
On 4 September 2018, teachers went on strike and took the streets of San Francisco de Macoris, Dominican Republic, to demand outstanding payments.
On 18 August 2018, truck drivers blocked the toll road in Santo Domingo de Guzman, Dominican Republic, against a law prohibiting them to use high-intensity lights on their vehicles.
On 17 August 2018, truck drivers went on strike and staged a protest in Puerto Plata, Dominican Republic.
Police Forces of the Dominican Republic (2004-2020)
Military Forces of the Dominican Republic (2004-2020)
On 17 August 2018, Dominican military and police clashed with Haitian security forces and citizens in the Comendador area, as some vans had been confiscated by the Dominican police.
On 16 August 2018, truck drivers went on strike and staged a protest in Puerto Plata, Dominican Republic.
On 15 August 2018, truck drivers went on strike and staged a protest in Puerto Plata, Dominican Republic.
On 14 August 2018, truck drivers went on strike and staged a protest in Puerto Plata, Dominican Republic.
On 13 August 2018, truck drivers went on strike and staged a protest in Puerto Plata, Dominican Republic.
On 12 August 2018, truck drivers went on strike and staged a protest in Puerto Plata, Dominican Republic.
Military Forces of the Dominican Republic (2004-2020)
Police Forces of the Dominican Republic (2004-2020)

On 11 August 2018, a joint operation between the military and police in La Romana, Dominican Republic, to find suspected drug traffickers, resulted in the death of two men under unclear circumstances.
FALPO: Broad Front for People's Fight
On 1 August 2018, during a protest in Navarrete, Bisono, to demand access to potable water, a woman was injured by bullets fired by FALPO people.
On 1 August 2018, teachers in Elias Pina, Dominican Republic, protested against the hiring of teachers from San Juan in their community. They demand for local teachers to be hired instead
FALPO: Broad Front for People's Fight

On 31 July 2018, demonstrators in Navarrete, Villa Bisono, Dominican Republic, burned tires and threw debris to demand for the government to build an aqueduct as they do not have access to clean water in their community.

On 24 July 2018, lawyers staged a protest in Los Alcarrizos, Dominican Republic, to demand for the public prosecutor to appear at work earlier in the morning. They state that his tardiness is affecting the situation at the Ministerio Publico.
Police Forces of the Dominican Republic (2004-2020)

On 9 July 2018, shots were fired at the police station in Navarrete, Villa Bisono, Dominican Republic, during a violent demonstration to demand for better government services. The community has not had access to potable water for over a week. [size=no report]
FALPO: Broad Front for People's Fight

On 2 July 2018, people in Esperanza, Dominican Republic, initiated a general strike and to demand better public services, such as the betterment of the roads. During the demonstration, the demonstrators threw debris on the roads.
On 30 June 2018, protesters part of the Marcha Verde organization, set up a camp in Santiago, Dominican Republic.
Police Forces of the Dominican Republic (2004-2020)
On 29 June 2018, protesters part of the Marcha Verde organization, set up a camp in Santiago, Dominican Republic, that was dismantled by the police. [size=no report]
Military Forces of the Dominican Republic (2004-2020)

On 18 June 2018, market vendors and producers in Dajabon, Dominican Republic, clashed using gunfire as some vendors do not wish to pay the fees due to sell at the market. The military intervened with gunfire. No one was injured.
Military Forces of the Dominican Republic (2004-2020)
Police Forces of the Dominican Republic (2004-2020)

On 14 June 2018, one prisoner died during a prison riot in Nagua, Dominican Republic. Two members of the military and four prisoners were injured during the riot with unknown origins. [size=no report]
Police Forces of the Dominican Republic (2004-2020)

On 12 June 2018, clashes between the police and rioters broke out during a general strike in Salcedo, Dominican Republic. Rioters fired guns and set on fire tires, the police used tear gas. [size=no report]
Police Forces of the Dominican Republic (2004-2020)
On 12 June 2018, clashes between the police and rioters broke out during a general strike in Las Guaranas, Dominican Republic. [size=no report]
Police Forces of the Dominican Republic (2004-2020)

On 12 June 2018, clashes between the police and rioters broke out during a general strike in San Francisco de Macoris, Dominican Republic. Rioters fired guns and set on fire tires, the police used tear gas. [size=no report]
Police Forces of the Dominican Republic (2004-2020)
On 10 June 2018, the police use tear gas against protesters in Bonao, Dominican Republic. [size=no report]

On 31 May 2018, people belonging to the group ''No Tenemos Miedo'' staged a protest in front of the National Palace in Santo Domingo, Dominican Republic, to demand for the country's border to close and for undocumented Haitians to be deported.
Police Forces of the Dominican Republic (2004-2020)

On 12 May 2018, a riot erupted around the Universidad Autonoma de Santo Domingo (UASD) in Santo Domingo, Dominican Republic. Rioters threw rocks and trash, to which the police responded with teargas. The exact reason for the demonstration is unknown. [size=no report]
On 22 April 2018, residents of La Guasana, San Francisco de Macoris, Dominican Republic, shot and killed a man who minutes earlier attempted to rob an elderly man and shot him. [size=no report]
On 18 April 2018, over 200 people protested the disappearance of a Dominican taxi driver in Haiti. They demand answers and are threatening for the Haitians living in the area to be deported.
Police Forces of the Dominican Republic (2004-2020)

On 18 April 2018, residents of Guayabal, Dominican Republic, protested to demand a road connecting the surrounding communities to be build. Police intervened to prevent protesters to block the road. [size=no report]

On 13 March 2018, in San Francisco de Macoris, Duarte, residents of the west side of the city went on a general strike to demand the authorities the construction of public side walks in the area. Home-made bombs and fire arms were detonated during the demonstration. No fatalities were reported. [size=no report].

On 12 March 2018, in Pedernales, Pedernales, residents of the border with Haiti clashed with Haitians nationals and threw rocks. The fight began after the funeral of a local farmer who was killed on 30 December 2017 by 3 Haitian nationals using machetes. No fatalities were reported. [size=no report].

On 6 March 2018, people staged a demonstration in Licey al Medio, Dominican Republic, to demand for better government services and better roads to be build in the community. During the demonstration rioters burned tires, fired shots, and threw debris. [size=no report]
Police Forces of the Dominican Republic (2004-2020)
El Nacional (Dominican Republic); El Nuevo Diario (Domincan Republic)

On 3 March 2018, students set on fire tires and blocked roads near la Universidad Autonoma de Santo Domingo in Santo Domingo, Dominican Republic to demonstrate against the traffic accidents associated with cars passing through the campus. Police intervened with tear gas. [size=no report]

On 27 February 2018, people burned a van, in Barcequilla, Bajos de Haina, Dominican Republic, to demand for the government to build a pedestrian bridge after four people died in an accident earlier that day.
On 15 February 2018, hundreds of teachers protested in Puerto Plata, Dominican Republic.
Police Forces of the Dominican Republic (2004-2020)

On 2 February 2018, residents of Los Alcarrizos staged a demonstration to demand better government services during which they burned tires and threw objects at the police. The police responded with tear gas and arrested several people. [size=no report]
On 9 February 2018, in Santo Domingo, hundreds of nurses staged a demonstration in front of Vinicio Calventi Regional Hospital to demand better working conditions. [size=hundreds].
On 9 February 2018, nurses in Los Alcarrizos, Dominican Republic, protested to demand for the government comply with the signed labor agreements.
On 22 January 2018, during a general strike in Moca, Dominican Republic, rioters blocked roads with burning tires and debris. Police presence was increased in the area.
Police Forces of the Dominican Republic (2004-2020)
On 20 January 2018, rioters in Boca Chica, Dominican Republic, set on fire a vehicle of the traffic police and threw rocks after a person died in an accident during a police chase. [size=no report]
On 18 January 2018, in Moca municipality, Espaillat, residents of El Caimito and La Rosario staged a demonstration to reject the construction of a propane gas plant in the area. [size=no report].

On 15 January 2018, demonstrators in El Limon, Samana, Dominican Republic, destroyed various utility poles and electricity grids to demand the electricity company to stop the regular power outages they are experiencing.
